net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.external

Class ExternalQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.external.ExternalQueue

  • public class ExternalQueue
extends Object
    Queues ExternalAction objects, other objects that handle the external "world" could also be queued here. There is normally one ExternalQueue per WindowManager.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected List queue
      The queue as a FIFO list.

    • Constructor Summary

      ExternalQueue()
      Create a new instance.

      void clear()
      Discard all pending items.

      Remove the next item from the queue that is an instance of the given class.
      ExternalAction deqAction()
      Remove the next ExternalAction from the queue.
      Object peek()
      Get the next item from the queue without removing it.
      Object peek(Class cl)
      Get the next item of the given class from the queue without removing it.

      Determines if there are pending items in the queue.

      Determines if there are pending items in the queue that are an instance of the given class.

      • peek

        Returns:
        Object or null if the queue is empty.

        Get the next item of the given class from the queue without removing it.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • pending

        public boolean pending()
        Determines if there are pending items in the queue.
        Returns:
        true if there are pending items in the queue.

      • pending

        public boolean pending(Class cl)
        Determines if there are pending items in the queue that are an instance of the given class.
        Parameters:
        cl - The class.
        Returns:
        true if any pending items are of the given class.

      • pendingAction

        public boolean pendingAction()
        Determines if any ExternalAction objects are pending.
        Returns:
        true if there are any pending ExternalAction instances.
